 2000:                              socket     => S,
 2001:                              port       => Port};
 2002:                        {error, Reason} ->
 2003:                            skip(?F("Failed open initial port: "
 2004:                                    "~p", [Reason]))
 2005:                    end
 2006:            end,
 2007:     TC   = fun(State) -> do_reconnect(State) end,
 2008:     Post = fun(#{socket := S}) -> ok = gen_udp:close(S) end,
 2009:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2010:             Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2011: 
 2012: do_reconnect(#{local_addr := Addr,
 2013:                socket     := S,
 2014:                port       := Port}) ->
 2015:     XtrnAddr = {8,8,8,8},
 2016:     DestPort = 53,
 2017:     %% Connect to a local destination
 2018:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S, Addr, DestPort),
 2019:     ?P("Socket connected: "
 2020:        "~n   socket info: ~p"
 2021:        "~n   SockName:    ~s"
 2022:        "~n   PeerName:    ~s", [inet:info(S), sn(S), pn(S)]),
 2023:     {ok, {Addr,      DestPort}} = inet:peername(S),
 2024:     {ok, {LocalAddr, Port}}     = inet:sockname(S),
 2025: 
 2026:     %% Reconnect to external destination
 2027:     ?P("try (re-)connect to (external): ~s", [atos({XtrnAddr, DestPort})]),
 2028:     case gen_udp:connect(S, XtrnAddr, DestPort) of
 2029:         ok ->
 2030:             ok;
 2031:         {error, Reason} ->
 2032:             ?P("Failed (re-)connect to external destination:"
 2033:                "~n   Extern Dest: ~s"
 2034:                "~n   Reason:      ~p", [atos({XtrnAddr, DestPort}), Reason]),
 2035:             ct:fail({extern_reconnect, Reason})
 2036:     end,
 2037:     ?P("Socket (re-)connected: "
 2038:        "~n   socket info: ~p"
 2039:        "~n   SockName:    ~s"
 2040:        "~n   PeerName:    ~s", [inet:info(S), sn(S), pn(S)]),
 2041:     {ok, {XtrnAddr,     DestPort}} = inet:peername(S),
 2042:     {ok, {RoutableAddr, Port}}     = inet:sockname(S),
 2043: 
 2044:     ?P("verify socket (routable) addr: ~p", [RoutableAddr]),
 2045:     %% We should have a non-loopback address here
 2046:     true = RoutableAddr =/= LocalAddr,
 2047: 
 2048:     %% Reconnect to local addr
 2049:     ?P("(re-)connect to local address: ~s", [atos({Addr, DestPort})]),
 2050:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S, Addr, DestPort),
 2051:     ?P("Socket (re-)connected: "
 2052:        "~n   socket info: ~p"
 2053:        "~n   SockName:    ~s"
 2054:        "~n   PeerName:    ~s", [inet:info(S), sn(S), pn(S)]),
 2055:     {ok, {Addr,      DestPort}} = inet:peername(S),
 2056:     {ok, {LocalAddr, Port}}     = inet:sockname(S),
 2057: 
 2058:     ?P("done"),
 2059:     ok.
 2060: 
 2061: pn(S) ->
 2062:     case inet:peername(S) of
 2063:         {ok, Addr} ->
 2064:             atos(Addr);
 2065:         {error, _} ->
 2066:             "undefined"
 2067:     end.
 2068: 
 2069: sn(S) ->
 2070:     case inet:sockname(S) of
 2071:         {ok, Addr} ->
 2072:             atos(Addr);
 2073:         {error, _} ->
 2074:             "undefined"
 2075:     end.
 2076: 
 2077: atos({A, P}) when is_tuple(A) andalso is_integer(P) ->
 2078:     ?F("~s:~w", [inet_parse:ntoa(A), P]).
 2079:             
 2080: %% For Linux to keep the port when we reconnect;
 2081: %% we need to first bind to a specific port.
 2082: %% If we bind to port 0 and get an ephemeral port
 2083: %% it apparently can change when we reconnect to a different
 2084: %% destination depending on routing and interfaces.
 2085: %%
 2086: %% I consider this a workaround for a Linux bug,
 2087: %% ironically in a test case that tests
 2088: %% a workaround for another Linux bug (related)...
 2089: %%
 2090: open_port_0(Config, Opts) ->
 2091:     open_port_0(Config, 0, Opts, 10).
 2092: %%
 2093: open_port_0(Config, Port, Opts, N) ->
 2094:     case ?OPEN(Config, Port, Opts) of
 2095:         {ok, S} ->
 2096:             if
 2097:                 Port =:= 0 ->
 2098:                     {ok, Port_1} = inet:port(S),
 2099:                     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 2100:                     %% Speculate that we can open a socket with that port
 2101:                     open_port_0(Config, Port_1, Opts, N);
 2102:                 true ->
 2103:                     ?P("Socket port: ~w", [Port]),
 2104:                     {ok, {S, Port}}
 2105:             end;
 2106:         {error, eaddrinuse} when Port =/= 0 ->
 2107:             open_port_0(Config, 0, Opts, N - 1);
 2108:         {error, _} = Error ->
 2109:             Error
 2110:     end.
 2111: 
 2112: 
 2113: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2114: 
 2115: implicit_inet6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2116:     ?TC_TRY(implicit_inet6, fun() -> do_implicit_inet6(Config) end).
 2117: 
 2118: do_implicit_inet6(Config) ->
 2119:     Host = ok(inet:gethostname()),
 2120:     case inet:getaddr(Host, inet6) of
 2121: 	{ok, {16#fe80,0,0,0,_,_,_,_} = Addr} ->
 2122: 	     ?SKIPT("Got link local IPv6 address: "
 2123:                     ++inet:ntoa(Addr));
 2124: 	{ok, Addr} ->
 2125: 	    implicit_inet6(Config, Host, Addr);
 2126: 	{error, Reason} ->
 2127: 	    ?SKIPT("Can not look up IPv6 address: "
 2128:                    ++atom_to_list(Reason))
 2129:     end.
 2130: 
 2131: implicit_inet6(Config, Host, Addr) ->
 2132:     Active   = {active,false},
 2133:     Loopback = {0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1},
 2134:     ?P("try 1 with explicit inet6 on loopback"),
 2135:     S1 = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [inet6, Active, {ip, Loopback}]) of
 2136:              {ok, Sock1} ->
 2137:                  Sock1;
 2138:              {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason1} ->
 2139:                  ?SKIPT(open_failed_str(Reason1));
 2140:              _ ->
 2141:                  ?SKIPT("IPv6 not supported")
 2142:          end,
 2143:     implicit_inet6(Config, S1, Active, Loopback),
 2144:     ok = gen_udp:close(S1),
 2145: 
 2146:     %%
 2147:     Localaddr = ok(get_localaddr()),
 2148:     ?P("try 2 on local addr (~p)", [Localaddr]),
 2149:     S2 = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Localaddr}, Active]) of
 2150:              {ok, Sock2} ->
 2151:                  Sock2;
 2152:              {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason2} ->
 2153:                  ?SKIPT(open_failed_str(Reason2))
 2154:          end,
 2155:     implicit_inet6(Config, S2, Active, Localaddr),
 2156:     ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 2157: 
 2158:     %%
 2159:     ?P("try 3 on addr ~p (~p)", [Addr, Host]),
 2160:     S3 = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr, Addr}, Active]) of
 2161:              {ok, Sock3} ->
 2162:                  Sock3;
 2163:              {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason3} ->
 2164:                  ?SKIPT(open_failed_str(Reason3))
 2165:          end,
 2166:     implicit_inet6(Config, S3, Active, Addr),
 2167:     ok = gen_udp:close(S3),
 2168:     ok.
 2169: 
 2170: implicit_inet6(Config, S1, Active, Addr) ->
 2171:     ?P("get (\"local\") port number"),
 2172:     P1 = ok(inet:port(S1)),
 2173:     ?P("open \"remote\" socket"),
 2174:     S2 = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [inet6, Active]) of
 2175:              {ok, Sock2} ->
 2176:                  Sock2;
 2177:              {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason3} ->
 2178:                  ?SKIPT(open_failed_str(Reason3))
 2179:          end,
 2180:     ?P("get (\"remote\") port number"),
 2181:     P2 = ok(inet:port(S2)),
 2182:     ?P("connect (\"remote\") socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2183:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S2, Addr, P1),
 2184:     ?P("connect (\"local\") socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P2]),
 2185:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S1, Addr, P2),
 2186:     ?P("peername of \"local\" socket"),
 2187:     {Addr,P2} = ok(inet:peername(S1)),
 2188:     ?P("peername of \"remote\" socket"),
 2189:     {Addr,P1} = ok(inet:peername(S2)),
 2190:     ?P("sockname of \"local\" socket"),
 2191:     {Addr,P1} = ok(inet:sockname(S1)),
 2192:     ?P("sockname of \"remote\" socket"),
 2193:     {Addr,P2} = ok(inet:sockname(S2)),
 2194:     ?P("send ping on \"local\" socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P2]),
 2195:     %% On some platforms its allowed to specify address and port
 2196:     %% (that is; when useing sendto) *even* if the socket is connected
 2197:     %% (assuming the send destination is the same as connected destination).
 2198:     %% But on other platforms, e.g. FreeBSD, this is *not* allowed!
 2199:     %% Linux:
 2200:     %%   EISCONN
 2201:     %%      The connection-mode socket was connected already but a recipient
 2202:     %%      was specified. (Now either this error is returned, or the re-
 2203:     %%      cipient specification is ignored.)
 2204:     %% FreeBSD:
 2205:     %%   [EISCONN]    A destination address was specified and the socket is
 2206:     %%                already connected.
 2207:     case gen_udp:send(S1, Addr, P2, "ping") of
 2208:         ok ->
 2209:             ?P("recv ping on \"remote\" socket (from ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2210:             {Addr,P1,"ping"} = ok(gen_udp:recv(S2, 1024, 1000)),
 2211:             ?P("send pong on \"remote\" socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2212:             ok = gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P1, "pong"),
 2213:             ?P("recv ping on \"local\" socket (from ~p:~p)", [Addr, P2]),
 2214:             {Addr,P2,"pong"} = ok(gen_udp:recv(S1, 1024)),
 2215:             ?P("close \"remote\" socket"),
 2216:             ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 2217:             ok;
 2218:         {error, eisconn} ->
 2219:             ?P("socket is connect => *not* allowed to use sendto"),
 2220:             ok = gen_udp:send(S1, "ping"),
 2221:             %% Not allowed to specify address *at all* for a connected socket
 2222:             ?P("recv ping on \"remote\" socket (from ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2223:             {Addr,P1,"ping"} = ok(gen_udp:recv(S2, 1024, 1000)),
 2224:             ?P("send pong on \"remote\" socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2225:             ok = gen_udp:send(S2, "pong"),
 2226:             ?P("recv ping on \"local\" socket (from ~p:~p)", [Addr, P2]),
 2227:             {Addr,P2,"pong"} = ok(gen_udp:recv(S1, 1024)),
 2228:             ?P("close \"remote\" socket"),
 2229:             ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 2230:             ok
 2231:     end.
 2232: 
 2233: 
 2234: 
 2235: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2236: 
 2237: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2238: %% We create a socket, then spawns processes that create
 2239: %% monitors to it...
 2240: socket_monitor1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2241:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2242:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor1,
 2243:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor1(Config) end).
 2244: 
 2245: do_socket_monitor1(Config) ->
 2246:     ?P("begin"),
 2247:     Self         = self(),
 2248:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2249:     {ok, Sock1} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2250:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2251:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 2252: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 2253: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2254: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2255: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 2256: 	 end,
 2257:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2258:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1),
 2259:     ?P("await client ready"),
 2260:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2261:     ?P("close socket"),
 2262:     gen_udp:close(Sock1),
 2263:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2264:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2265:     ?P("done"),
 2266:     ok.
 2267: 
 2268: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 2269:     sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 2270: 
 2271: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 2272:     receive
 2273: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) andalso 
 2274: 					     (Mon  =:= ExpMon)  andalso 
 2275: 					     (Sock =:= ExpSock) ->
 2276: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 2277: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 2278: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 2279: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 2280: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 2281: 	    exit(ok);
 2282: 
 2283: 	Any ->
 2284: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 2285: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Any]),
 2286: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any})
 2287:     end.
 2288: 
 2289: sm_await_client_ready(Pid) ->
 2290:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid, "client").
 2291: 
 2292: sm_await_client_ready(Pid, Name) ->
 2293:     receive
 2294: 	{Pid, ready} ->
 2295: 	    ?P("received ~s ready", [Name])
 2296:     end.
 2297: 
 2298: sm_await_down(Pid, Mon, ExpRes) ->
 2299:     receive
 2300: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, ExpRes} ->
 2301: 	    ?P("received expected process down message from ~p", [Pid]),
 2302: 	    ok;
 2303: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, UnexpRes} ->
 2304: 	    ?P("received unexpected process down message from ~p: "
 2305: 	       "~n   ~p", [Pid, UnexpRes]),
 2306: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_down, UnexpRes})
 2307:     end.
 2308: 
 2309: 
 2310: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2311: 
 2312: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2313: %% We create "many" socket(s), then spawn processes that create
 2314: %% monitors to them...
 2315: socket_monitor1_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2316:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2317:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor1_manys,
 2318:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config) end).
 2319: 
 2320: do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config) ->
 2321:     ?P("begin"),
 2322:     Self         = self(),
 2323:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2324:     ?P("[client] create socket(s)"),
 2325:     {ok, Sock1} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2326:     {ok, Sock2} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2327:     {ok, Sock3} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2328:     {ok, Sock4} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2329:     {ok, Sock5} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2330:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2331:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 2332: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 2333: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 2334: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 2335: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2336: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 2337: 	 end,
 2338:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2339:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F([Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5], F1),
 2340:     ?P("await client ready"),
 2341:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2342:     ?P("close socket(s)"),
 2343:     gen_udp:close(Sock1),
 2344:     gen_udp:close(Sock2),
 2345:     gen_udp:close(Sock3),
 2346:     gen_udp:close(Sock4),
 2347:     gen_udp:close(Sock5),
 2348:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2349:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2350:     ?P("done"),
 2351:     ok.
 2352: 
 2353: 
 2354: sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType) ->
 2355:     sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType, "client").
 2356: 
 2357: sm_await_socket_down2([], _ExpType, Name) ->
 2358:     ?P("[~s] all sockets down", [Name]),
 2359:     exit(ok);
 2360: sm_await_socket_down2(Mons, ExpType, Name) when is_list(Mons) ->
 2361:     ?P("[~s] await socket down", [Name]),
 2362:     receive
 2363: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) ->
 2364: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 2365: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 2366: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 2367: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 2368: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 2369: 	    case lists:keysearch(Mon, 1, Mons) of
 2370: 		{value, {Mon, Sock}} ->
 2371: 		    Mons2 = lists:keydelete(Mon, 1, Mons),
 2372: 		    sm_await_socket_down2(Mons2, ExpType, Name);
 2373: 		{value, Value} ->
 2374: 		    ?P("[~s] Unexpected socket down: "
 2375: 		       "~n   Value: ~p", [Name, Value]),
 2376: 		    ct:fail({unexpected_monitor, Mon, Value});
 2377: 		false ->
 2378: 		    ct:fail({unknown_monitor, Mon})
 2379: 	    end
 2380:     end.
 2381: 
 2382: 
 2383: 
 2384: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2385: 
 2386: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2387: %% We create a socket, then spawn client process(es) that create
 2388: %% monitors to it...
 2389: socket_monitor1_manyc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2390:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2391:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor1_manyc,
 2392:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor1_manyc(Config) end).
 2393: 
 2394: do_socket_monitor1_manyc(Config) ->
 2395:     ?P("begin"),
 2396:     Self         = self(),
 2397:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2398:     {ok, Sock1}  = ?OPEN(Config),
 2399:     F  = fun(S, Fun, Name) ->
 2400: 		 spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Name, Self) end)
 2401: 	 end,
 2402:     F1 = fun(Socket, Name, Parent) when is_list(Name) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 2403: 		 ?P("[~s] monitor socket", [Name]),
 2404: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2405: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2406: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 2407: 	 end,
 2408:     ?P("spawn client(s)"),
 2409:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1, "client1"),
 2410:     {Pid2, Mon2} = F(Sock1, F1, "client2"),
 2411:     {Pid3, Mon3} = F(Sock1, F1, "client3"),
 2412:     {Pid4, Mon4} = F(Sock1, F1, "client4"),
 2413:     {Pid5, Mon5} = F(Sock1, F1, "client5"),
 2414:     ?P("await client(s) ready"),
 2415:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1, "client1"),
 2416:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid2, "client2"),
 2417:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid3, "client3"),
 2418:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid4, "client4"),
 2419:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid5, "client5"),
 2420:     ?P("close socket"),
 2421:     gen_udp:close(Sock1),
 2422:     ?P("await client(s) termination"),
 2423:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2424:     sm_await_down(Pid2, Mon2, ok),
 2425:     sm_await_down(Pid3, Mon3, ok),
 2426:     sm_await_down(Pid4, Mon4, ok),
 2427:     sm_await_down(Pid5, Mon5, ok),
 2428:     ?P("done"),
 2429:     ok.
 2430: 
 2431: 
 2432: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2433: 
 2434: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2435: %% We create a socket, then spawns processes that create
 2436: %% monitors to it...
 2437: socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2438:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2439:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor1_demon_after,
 2440:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config) end).
 2441: 
 2442: do_socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config) ->
 2443:     ?P("begin"),
 2444:     Self         = self(),
 2445:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2446:     {ok, Sock1}  = ?OPEN(Config),
 2447:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2448:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 2449: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 2450: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2451: 		 ?P("[client] sleep some"),
 2452: 		 ?SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 2453: 		 ?P("[client] cancel (socket) monitor"),
 2454: 		 inet:cancel_monitor(MRef),
 2455: 		 ?P("[client] announce ready"),
 2456: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2457: 		 sm_await_no_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 2458: 	 end,
 2459:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2460:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1),
 2461:     ?P("await client ready"),
 2462:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2463:     ?P("close socket"),
 2464:     gen_udp:close(Sock1),
 2465:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2466:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2467:     ?P("done"),
 2468:     ok.
 2469: 
 2470: 
 2471: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 2472:     sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 2473: 
 2474: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 2475:     receive
 2476: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) andalso 
 2477: 					     (Mon  =:= ExpMon)  andalso 
 2478: 					     (Sock =:= ExpSock) ->
 2479: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected (socket) down message: "
 2480: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 2481: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 2482: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 2483: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 2484: 	    exit({unexpected_down, Mon, Type, Sock, Info});
 2485: 
 2486: 	Any ->
 2487: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 2488: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Any]),
 2489: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any})
 2490: 
 2491:     after 1000 ->
 2492: 	    ?P("[~s] expected message timeout", [Name]),
 2493: 	    exit(ok)
 2494:     end.
 2495: 
 2496: 
 2497: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2498: 
 2499: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2500: %% Spawn a process that creates a socket, then spawns processes
 2501: %% that create monitors to it...
 2502: socket_monitor2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2503:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2504:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor2,
 2505:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor2(Config) end).
 2506: 
 2507: do_socket_monitor2(Config) ->
 2508:     ?P("begin"),
 2509:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2510:     Self         = self(),
 2511:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 2512: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 2513: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket"),
 2514: 			      {ok, S} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2515: 			      ?P("[owner] send socket to ctrl"),
 2516: 			      Self ! {socket, S},
 2517: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 2518: 			      receive
 2519: 				  {Self, die} ->
 2520: 				      exit(normal)
 2521: 			      end
 2522: 		      end),
 2523:     Sock1 = receive
 2524:                 {socket, S} ->
 2525:                     ?P("received socket from owner"),
 2526:                     S;
 2527:                 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 2528:                     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 2529:                        "~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 2530:                     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 2531: 	     end,
 2532:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2533:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 2534: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 2535: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2536: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2537: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 2538: 	 end,
 2539:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2540:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1),
 2541:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2542:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2543:     ?P("kill owner"),
 2544:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 2545:     ?P("await owner termination"),
 2546:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 2547:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2548:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2549:     ?P("done"),
 2550:     ok.
 2551: 
 2552: 
 2553: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2554: 
 2555: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2556: %% Spawn a process that creates "many" socket(s), then spawns
 2557: %% a process that create monitors to them...
 2558: 
 2559: socket_monitor2_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2560:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2561:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor2_manys,
 2562:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor2_manys(Config) end).
 2563: 
 2564: do_socket_monitor2_manys(Config) ->
 2565:     ?P("begin"),
 2566:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2567:     Self         = self(),
 2568:     ?P("spawn owner"),
 2569:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 2570: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 2571: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket(s)"),
 2572: 			      {ok, S1} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2573: 			      {ok, S2} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2574: 			      {ok, S3} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2575: 			      {ok, S4} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2576: 			      {ok, S5} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2577: 			      ?P("[owner] send (listen) socket(s) to ctrl"),
 2578: 			      Self ! {socket, [S1, S2, S3, S4, S5]},
 2579: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 2580: 			      receive
 2581: 				  {Self, die} ->
 2582: 				      exit(normal)
 2583: 			      end
 2584: 		      end),
 2585:     ?P("await sockets (from owner)"),
 2586:     Socks = receive
 2587:                 {socket, Ss} ->
 2588:                     ?P("received socket(s) from owner"),
 2589:                     Ss;
 2590:                 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 2591:                     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 2592:                        "~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 2593:                     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 2594:             end,
 2595:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2596:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 2597: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 2598: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 2599: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 2600: 		 ?P("[client] announce ready"),
 2601: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2602: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 2603: 	 end,
 2604:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2605:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Socks, F1),
 2606:     ?P("await client ready"),
 2607:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2608:     ?P("kill owner"),
 2609:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 2610:     ?P("await owner (~p) termination", [OwnerPid]),
 2611:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 2612:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2613:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2614:     ?P("done"),
 2615:     ok.
 2616: 
 2617: 
 2618: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2619: 
 2620: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2621: %% Spawn a process that creates a socket, then spawns (client)
 2622: %% processes that create monitors to it...
 2623: socket_monitor2_manyc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2624:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2625:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor2_manyc,
 2626:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor2_manyc(Config) end).
 2627: 
 2628: do_socket_monitor2_manyc(Config) ->
 2629:     ?P("begin"),
 2630:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2631:     Self         = self(),
 2632:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 2633: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 2634: 			      {ok, S} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2635: 			      Self ! {socket, S},
 2636: 			      receive
 2637: 				  {Self, die} ->
 2638: 				      exit(normal)
 2639: 			      end
 2640: 		      end),
 2641:     Sock1 = receive
 2642: 		 {socket, S} ->
 2643: 		     ?P("received socket from owner"),
 2644: 		     S;
 2645: 		 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 2646: 		     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 2647: 			"~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 2648: 		     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 2649: 	     end,
 2650:     F  = fun(S, Fun, Name) ->
 2651: 		 spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Name, Self) end)
 2652: 	 end,
 2653:     F1 = fun(Socket, Name, Parent) when is_list(Name) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 2654: 		 ?P("[~s] create monitor", [Name]),
 2655: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2656: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2657: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type, Name)
 2658: 	 end,
 2659:     ?P("spawn client(s)"),
 2660:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1, "client1"),
 2661:     {Pid2, Mon2} = F(Sock1, F1, "client2"),
 2662:     {Pid3, Mon3} = F(Sock1, F1, "client3"),
 2663:     {Pid4, Mon4} = F(Sock1, F1, "client4"),
 2664:     {Pid5, Mon5} = F(Sock1, F1, "client5"),
 2665:     ?P("await client(s) ready"),
 2666:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1, "client1"),
 2667:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid2, "client2"),
 2668:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid3, "client3"),
 2669:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid4, "client4"),
 2670:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid5, "client5"),
 2671:     ?P("kill owner"),
 2672:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 2673:     ?P("await owner termination"),
 2674:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 2675:     ?P("await client(s) termination"),
 2676:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2677:     sm_await_down(Pid2, Mon2, ok),
 2678:     sm_await_down(Pid3, Mon3, ok),
 2679:     sm_await_down(Pid4, Mon4, ok),
 2680:     sm_await_down(Pid5, Mon5, ok),
 2681:     ?P("done"),
 2682:     ok.
 2683: 
 2684: 
 2685: 
 2686: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2687: 
 2688: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2689: %% Spawn a process that creates a socket, then spawns (client)
 2690: %% processes that create monitors to it...
 2691: otp_17492(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2692:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2693:     ?TC_TRY(otp_17492, fun() -> do_otp_17492(Config) end).
 2694: 
 2695: do_otp_17492(Config) ->
 2696:     ?P("begin"),
 2697: 
 2698:     Self = self(),
 2699: 
 2700:     ?P("try create socket"),
 2701:     {ok, L} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, []),
 2702: 
 2703:     ?P("try get (created) socket info"),
 2704:     try inet:info(L) of
 2705: 	#{owner := Owner} = Info when is_pid(Owner) andalso (Owner =:= Self) ->
 2706: 	    ?P("(created) socket info: ~p", [Info]);
 2707: 	OBadInfo ->
 2708: 	    ?P("(created) socket info: ~p", [OBadInfo]),
 2709: 	    (catch gen_udp:close(L)),
 2710: 	    ct:fail({invalid_created_info, OBadInfo})
 2711:     catch
 2712: 	OC:OE:OS ->
 2713: 	    ?P("Failed get (created) Listen socket info: "
 2714: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 2715: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 2716: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [OC, OE, OS]),
 2717: 	    (catch gen_udp:close(L)),
 2718: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_created_info_result, {OC, OE, OS}})
 2719:     end,
 2720: 
 2721:     ?P("try close socket"),
 2722:     ok = gen_udp:close(L),
 2723: 
 2724:     ?P("try get (closed) socket info"),
 2725:     try inet:info(L) of
 2726: 	#{states := [closed]} = CInfo when is_port(L) ->
 2727: 	    ?P("(closed) socket info: "
 2728: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 2729: 	#{rstates := [closed], wstates := [closed]} = CInfo ->
 2730: 	    ?P("(closed) socket info: "
 2731: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 2732: 	CBadInfo ->
 2733: 	    ?P("(closed) socket info: ~p", [CBadInfo]),
 2734: 	    ct:fail({invalid_closed_info, CBadInfo})
 2735:     catch
 2736: 	CC:CE:CS ->
 2737: 	    ?P("Failed get (closed) socket info: "
 2738: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 2739: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 2740: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [CC, CE, CS]),
 2741: 	    (catch gen_udp:close(L)),
 2742: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_closed_info_result, {CC, CE, CS}})
 2743:     end,
 2744: 
 2745:     ?P("done"),
 2746:     ok.
 2747: 
 2748: 
 2749: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2750: 
 2751: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2752: 
 2753: %% Here we use socket:sockaddr_in6() when creating and using the
 2754: %% socket(s).
 2755: %%
 2756: t_simple_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2757:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2758:             fun() -> ?LIB:has_support_ipv6() end,
 2759:             fun() ->
 2760:                     Domain = inet6,
 2761:                     LocalAddr =
 2762:                         case ?LIB:which_local_addr(Domain) of
 2763:                             {ok, LA} ->
 2764:                                 LA;
 2765:                         {error, _} ->
 2766:                             skip("No local address")
 2767:                     end,
 2768:                     SockAddr = #{family   => Domain,
 2769:                                  addr     => LocalAddr,
 2770:                                  port     => 0},
 2771:                     do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(SockAddr, Config)
 2772:             end).
 2773: 
 2774: 
 2775: t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2776:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2777:             fun() ->
 2778:                     ?LIB:has_support_ipv6(),
 2779:                     is_net_supported(),
 2780:                     is_not_darwin()
 2781:             end,
 2782:             fun() ->
 2783:                     Domain = inet6,
 2784:                     LinkLocalAddr =
 2785:                         case ?LIB:which_link_local_addr(Domain) of
 2786:                             {ok, LLA} ->
 2787:                                 LLA;
 2788:                             {error, _} ->
 2789:                                 skip("No link local address")
 2790:                         end,
 2791:                     Filter =
 2792:                         fun(#{addr := #{family := D,
 2793:                                         addr   := A}} = C) ->
 2794:                                 if 
 2795:                                     (D =:= Domain) andalso
 2796:                                     (A =:= LinkLocalAddr) ->
 2797:                                         ?P("found link-local candidate: "
 2798:                                            "~n   ~p", [C]),
 2799:                                         true;
 2800:                                     true ->
 2801:                                         false
 2802:                                 end;
 2803:                            (_) ->
 2804:                                 false
 2805:                         end,
 2806:                     case net:getifaddrs(Filter) of
 2807:                         {ok, [#{addr := #{scope_id := ScopeID}}=H|T]} ->
 2808:                             ?P("found link-local candidate(s): "
 2809:                                "~n   Candidate:       ~p"
 2810:                                "~n   Rest Candidate:  ~p", [H, T]),
 2811:                             SockAddr = #{family   => Domain,
 2812:                                          addr     => LinkLocalAddr,
 2813:                                          port     => 0,
 2814:                                          scope_id => ScopeID},
 2815:                             do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(SockAddr, Config);
 2816:                         {ok, _} ->
 2817:                             skip("Scope ID not found");
 2818:                         {error, R} ->
 2819:                             skip({failed_getifaddrs, R})
 2820:                     end
 2821:             end).
 2822: 
 2823: t_simple_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2824:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2825:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2826:             fun() -> ok end,
 2827:             fun() ->
 2828:                     Domain = inet,
 2829:                     LocalAddr =
 2830:                         case ?LIB:which_local_addr(Domain) of
 2831:                             {ok, LA} ->
 2832:                                 LA;
 2833:                         {error, _} ->
 2834:                             skip("No local address")
 2835:                     end,
 2836:                     SockAddr = #{family   => Domain,
 2837:                                  addr     => LocalAddr,
 2838:                                  port     => 0},
 2839:                     do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(SockAddr, Config)
 2840:             end).
 2841: 
 2842: t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2843:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2844:             fun() -> ok end,
 2845:             fun() ->
 2846:                     Domain = inet,
 2847:                     LinkLocalAddr =
 2848:                         case ?LIB:which_link_local_addr(Domain) of
 2849:                             {ok, LLA} ->
 2850:                                 LLA;
 2851:                             {error, _} ->
 2852:                                 skip("No link local address")
 2853:                         end,
 2854:                     SockAddr = #{family => Domain,
 2855:                                  addr   => LinkLocalAddr,
 2856:                                  port   => 0},
 2857:                     do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(SockAddr, Config)
 2858:             end).
 2859: 
 2860: 
 2861: do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(#{family := _Fam} = SockAddr, _) ->
 2862:     %% Create the server
 2863:     Self   = self(),
 2864:     ?P("~n      SockAddr: ~p", [SockAddr]),
 2865:     ServerF = fun() ->
 2866:                       ?P("[server] try create socket"),
 2867:                       Sock =
 2868:                           try gen_udp:open(0, [{ifaddr, SockAddr},
 2869:                                                {active, true},
 2870:                                                binary]) of
 2871:                               {ok, S} ->
 2872:                                   S;
 2873:                               {error, OReason} ->
 2874:                                   ?P("[server] open error: "
 2875:                                      "~n      Reason: ~p", [OReason]),
 2876:                                   exit({open_error, OReason})
 2877:                           catch
 2878:                               OC:OE:OS ->
 2879:                                   ?P("[server] open failure: "
 2880:                                      "~n      Error Class: ~p"
 2881:                                      "~n      Error:       ~p"
 2882:                                      "~n      Call Stack:  ~p", [OC, OE, OS]),
 2883:                                   exit({open_failure, {OC, OE, OS}})
 2884:                           end,
 2885:                       ?P("[server] try get port"),
 2886:                       {ok, Port}  = inet:port(Sock),
 2887:                       ?P("[server] port: ~w", [Port]),
 2888:                       Self ! {{port, Port}, self()},
 2889: 
 2890: 
 2891:                       %% --- message sequance 1 ---
 2892: 
 2893:                       ?P("[server] await message 1"),
 2894:                       {CIP, CPort} =
 2895:                           receive
 2896:                               {udp, Sock, CIP1, CPort1, <<"hej">>} ->
 2897:                                   ?P("[server] received expected message 1 - "
 2898:                                      "connect to *this* client"),
 2899:                                   ok = gen_udp:connect(Sock, CIP1, CPort1),
 2900:                                   ?P("[server] send reply"),
 2901:                                   case gen_udp:send(Sock, "hopp") of
 2902:                                       ok -> 
 2903:                                           {CIP1, CPort1};
 2904:                                       {error, ehostunreach = Reason1} ->
 2905:                                           ?P("[server] send failed: ~p",
 2906:                                              [Reason1]),
 2907:                                           exit({skip, Reason1});
 2908:                                       {error, enetunreach = Reason1} ->
 2909:                                           ?P("[server] send failed: ~p",
 2910:                                              [Reason1]),
 2911:                                           exit({skip, Reason1});
 2912:                                       {error, Reason1} ->
 2913:                                           exit({send_failed, Reason1})
 2914:                                   end
 2915:                           after 5000 ->
 2916:                                   ?P("[server] receive (1) timeout:"
 2917:                                      "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 2918:                                   exit(receive_timeout)
 2919:                           end,
 2920: 
 2921: 
 2922:                       %% --- message sequance 2 ---
 2923: 
 2924:                       ?P("[server] await message 2"),
 2925:                       receive
 2926:                           {udp, Sock, CIP2, CPort2, <<"hej">>}
 2927:                             when (CIP2 =:= CIP) andalso (CPort2 =:= CPort) ->
 2928:                               ?P("[server] received expected message 2 - "
 2929:                                  "send reply"),
 2930:                               case gen_udp:send(Sock, "hopp") of
 2931:                                   ok -> 
 2932:                                       ok;
 2933:                                   {error, ehostunreach = Reason2} ->
 2934:                                       ?P("[server] send failed: ~p",
 2935:                                          [Reason2]),
 2936:                                       exit({skip, Reason2});
 2937:                                   {error, enetunreach = Reason2} ->
 2938:                                       ?P("[server] send failed: ~p",
 2939:                                          [Reason2]),
 2940:                                       exit({skip, Reason2});
 2941:                                   {error, Reason2} ->
 2942:                                       exit({send_failed, Reason2})
 2943:                               end
 2944:                       after 5000 ->
 2945:                               ?P("[server] receive (2) timeout:"
 2946:                                  "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 2947:                               exit(receive_timeout)
 2948:                       end,
 2949: 
 2950: 
 2951:                       %% --- message sequance 3 ---
 2952: 
 2953:                       ?P("[server] await message 3"),
 2954:                       receive
 2955:                           {udp, Sock, CIP3, CPort3, <<"hej">>}
 2956:                             when (CIP3 =:= CIP) andalso (CPort3 =:= CPort) ->
 2957:                               ?P("[server] received expected message 3 - "
 2958:                                  "send reply"),
 2959:                               ok = gen_udp:send(Sock, "hopp")
 2960:                       after 5000 ->
 2961:                               ?P("[server] receive (3) timeout:"
 2962:                                  "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 2963:                               exit(receive_timeout)
 2964:                       end,
 2965: 
 2966: 
 2967:                       %% --- message sequance 4 ---
 2968: 
 2969:                       ?P("[server] await message 4 - should be none!"),
 2970:                       receive
 2971:                           {udp, Sock, CIP4, CPort4, <<"hej">>} ->
 2972:                               ?P("[server] received unexpected message 4:"
 2973:                                  "~n      Address: ~p"
 2974:                                  "~n      Port:    ~p", [CIP4, CPort4]),
 2975:                               exit({unexpected_message, CIP4, CPort4})
 2976:                       after
 2977:                           1000 ->
 2978:                               ?P("Received nothing - expected"),
 2979:                               Self ! {nothing, self()}
 2980:                       end,
 2981: 
 2982:                       ?P("[server] await termination command"),
 2983:                       receive
 2984:                           {die, Self} ->
 2985:                               ?P("[server] terminating"),
 2986:                               (catch gen_udp:close(Sock)),
 2987:                               exit(normal)
 2988:                       end
 2989:               end,
 2990:     ?P("try start server"),
 2991:     Server = spawn_link(ServerF),
 2992:     ?P("server started - await port "),
 2993:     ServerPort = receive
 2994:                      {{port, Port}, Server} ->
 2995:                          Port;
 2996:                      {'EXIT', Server, Reason} ->
 2997:                          ?P("server died unexpectedly: "
 2998:                             "~n      ~p", [Reason]),
 2999:                          exit({unexpected_server_failure, Reason})
 3000:                  end,
 3001:     ?P("server port received: ~p", [ServerPort]),
 3002:     
 3003:     ?P("try connect to server"),
 3004:     ServerSockAddr = SockAddr#{port => ServerPort},
 3005:     {ok, CSock1} = gen_udp:open(0,
 3006:                                 [{ifaddr, SockAddr},
 3007:                                  {active, true},
 3008:                                  binary]),
 3009:     {ok, CSock2} = gen_udp:open(0,
 3010:                                 [{ifaddr, SockAddr},
 3011:                                  {active, true},
 3012:                                  binary]),
 3013:     ?P("client socket: "
 3014:        "~n      CSock 1: ~p"
 3015:        "~n      CPort 1: ~p"
 3016:        "~n      CSock 2: ~p"
 3017:        "~n      CPort 2: ~p",
 3018:        [CSock1, inet:port(CSock1), CSock2, inet:port(CSock2)]),
 3019: 
 3020: 
 3021:     %% --- message sequance 1 ---
 3022: 
 3023:     ?P("[csock 1] try (trad = address and port) send message 1"),
 3024:     case gen_udp:send(CSock1, maps:get(addr, SockAddr), ServerPort, "hej") of
 3025:         ok ->
 3026:             ok;
 3027:         {error, ehostunreach = Reason1} ->
 3028:             ?SKIPT(?F("send (1,1) failed: ~p", [Reason1]));
 3029:         {error, Reason1} ->
 3030:             ct:fail({send_failed, Reason1})
 3031:     end,
 3032:                  
 3033: 
 3034:     ?P("[csock 1] await reply message 1"),
 3035:     receive
 3036:         {udp, CSock1, _, _, <<"hopp">>} ->
 3037:             ?P("[csock 1] received expected reply message 1"),
 3038:             ok;
 3039: 
 3040:         {'EXIT', Server, {skip, SReason1}} ->
 3041:             ?P("received unexpected server skip exit (1):"
 3042:                "~n      ~p", [SReason1]),
 3043:             ?SKIPT(?F("server send (1,1) failed: ~p", [SReason1]));
 3044: 
 3045:         {'EXIT', Server, SReason1} ->
 3046:             ?P("received unexpected server exit (1):"
 3047:                "~n      ~p", [SReason1]),
 3048:             ct:fail({unexpected_server_exit, 1, SReason1})
 3049: 
 3050:     after 5000 ->
 3051:             ?P("receive (1) timeout:"
 3052:                "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 3053:             ct:fail(receive_timeout)
 3054:     end,
 3055: 
 3056: 
 3057:     %% --- message sequance 2 ---
 3058: 
 3059:     ?P("[csock 1] try (sockaddr) send message 2"),
 3060:     %% DstSockAddr = #{family => maps:get(family, SockAddr),
 3061:     %%                 addr   => maps:get(addr, SockAddr),
 3062:     %%                 port   => ServerPort},
 3063:     DstSockAddr = ServerSockAddr,
 3064:     case gen_udp:send(CSock1, DstSockAddr, "hej") of
 3065:         ok ->
 3066:             ok;
 3067:         {error, ehostunreach = Reason2} ->
 3068:             ?SKIPT(?F("send (1,2) failed: ~p", [Reason2]));
 3069:         {error, Reason2} ->
 3070:             ct:fail({send_failed, Reason2})
 3071:     end,
 3072:         
 3073: 
 3074:     ?P("[csock 1] await reply message 2"),
 3075:     receive
 3076:         {udp, CSock1, _, _, <<"hopp">>} ->
 3077:             ?P("[csock 1] received expected reply message 2"),
 3078:             ok;
 3079: 
 3080:         {'EXIT', Server, {skip, SReason2}} ->
 3081:             ?P("received unexpected server skip exit (2):"
 3082:                "~n      ~p", [SReason2]),
 3083:             ?SKIPT(?F("server send (1,2) failed: ~p", [SReason2]));
 3084: 
 3085:         {'EXIT', Server, SReason2} ->
 3086:             ?P("received unexpected server exit (2):"
 3087:                "~n.     ~p", [SReason2]),
 3088:             ct:fail({unexpected_server_exit, 2, SReason2})
 3089: 
 3090:     after 5000 ->
 3091:             ?P("[csock 1] receive (2) timeout:"
 3092:                "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 3093:             ct:fail(receive_timeout)
 3094:     end,
 3095: 
 3096: 
 3097:     %% --- message sequance 3 ---
 3098: 
 3099:     ?P("[csock 1] try connect to: "
 3100:        "~n      ~p", [ServerSockAddr]),
 3101:     ok = gen_udp:connect(CSock1, DstSockAddr),
 3102: 
 3103:     ?P("[csock 1] try send message 3"),
 3104:     ok = gen_udp:send(CSock1, "hej"),
 3105: 
 3106:     ?P("[csock 1] await reply message 3"),
 3107:     receive
 3108:         {udp, CSock1, _, _, <<"hopp">>} ->
 3109:             ?P("received expected reply message 3"),
 3110:             ok;
 3111: 
 3112:         {'EXIT', Server, SReason3} ->
 3113:             ?P("received unexpected server exit (3):"
 3114:                "~n.     ~p", [SReason3]),
 3115:             ct:fail({unexpected_server_exit, 3, SReason3})
 3116: 
 3117:     after 5000 ->
 3118:             ?P("[csock 1] receive (2) timeout:"
 3119:                "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 3120:             ct:fail(receive_timeout)
 3121: 
 3122:     end,
 3123: 
 3124: 
 3125:     %% --- message sequance 4 ---
 3126: 
 3127:     ?P("[csock 2] try (sockaddr) send message 4"),
 3128:     ok = gen_udp:send(CSock2, DstSockAddr, "hej"),
 3129: 
 3130:     ?P("[csock 2] await reply message 4 - expect failure"),
 3131:     receive
 3132:         {udp, CSock2, _, _, <<"hopp">>} ->
 3133:             ?P("[csock 2] received unexpected reply message 4"),
 3134:             exit(received_unexpected_message);
 3135:         {nothing, Server} ->
 3136:             ?P("[csock 2] server received nothing - expected"),
 3137:             ok
 3138:     end,
 3139: 
 3140: 
 3141:     ?P("terminate server"),
 3142:     Server ! {die, self()},
 3143: 
 3144:     ?P("await server termination"),
 3145:     receive
 3146:         {'EXIT', Server, normal} ->
 3147:             ok
 3148:     end,
 3149:     
 3150:     ?P("cleanup"),
 3151:     (catch gen_udp:close(CSock1)),
 3152:     (catch gen_udp:close(CSock2)),
 3153: 
 3154:     ?P("done"),
 3155:     ok.
 3156: 
 3157:     
 3158: 
 3159: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3160: 
 3161: %% Verify that the options [add|drop]_membership do not mess up
 3162: %% the options (including 'ip' which could not be added *after*).
 3163: %% This just attempts to very that the option processing is ok.
 3164: otp_18323_opts_processing(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3165:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 3166:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_otp_18323_opts_processing(Config) end).
 3167: 
 3168: do_otp_18323_opts_processing(_Config) ->
 3169:     ?P("begin"),
 3170: 
 3171:     do_otp_18323_opts_processing_verify(
 3172:       {add_membership,  {{239,1,2,3},{0,0,0,0}}}),
 3173: 
 3174:     do_otp_18323_opts_processing_verify(
 3175:       {drop_membership, {{239,1,2,3},{0,0,0,0}}}),
 3176: 
 3177:     ?P("done"),
 3178:     ok.
 3179: 
 3180: do_otp_18323_opts_processing_verify(MembershipOpt) ->
 3181:     Port   = 4321,
 3182:     RecBuf = 123456,
 3183:     Active = 10,
 3184:     IP     = {1,2,3,4},
 3185:     Opts   = [binary, MembershipOpt, {ip, IP}, {active, Active}],
 3186: 
 3187:     case inet:udp_options([{port, Port}, {recbuf, RecBuf} | Opts], inet_udp) of
 3188:         {ok, #udp_opts{ifaddr = IP,
 3189:                        port   = Port,
 3190:                        opts   = SockOpts}} ->
 3191:             ?P("Processed Socket Options: "
 3192:                "~n   IfAddr:    ~p"
 3193:                "~n   Port:      ~p"
 3194:                "~n   Sock Opts: ~p", [IP, Port, SockOpts]),
 3195:             %% Check that the recbuf and mode options are as expected
 3196:             %% The option 'binary' is shorthand for {mode, binary}
 3197:             {value, {recbuf, RecBuf}} = lists:keysearch(recbuf, 1, SockOpts),
 3198:             {value, {mode,   binary}} = lists:keysearch(mode,   1, SockOpts),
 3199:             {value, {active, Active}} = lists:keysearch(active, 1, SockOpts),
 3200:             ok;
 3201:         {error, Reason} ->
 3202:             exit(?F("Failed processing options: ~p", [Reason]))
 3203:     end.
 3204: 
 3205: 
 3206: 
 3207: 
 3208: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3209: 
 3210: %% Verify that the options [add|drop]_membership do not mess up
 3211: %% the options (including 'ip' which could not be added *after*).
 3212: otp_18323_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3213:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 3214:     Pre  = fun() ->
 3215:                    {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
 3216:                    #{local_addr => Addr}
 3217:            end,
 3218:     Case = fun(State) -> do_otp_18323_open(State) end,
 3219:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 3220:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Pre, Case, Post).
 3221: 
 3222: do_otp_18323_open(#{local_addr := Addr}) ->
 3223:     ?P("begin"),
 3224: 
 3225:     ROpts = [binary,
 3226:              {add_membership, {Addr,{0,0,0,0}}},
 3227:              {ip, Addr},
 3228:              {active,false},
 3229:              {debug, true}],
 3230:     SOpts = [{reuseaddr, true}, binary],
 3231: 
 3232:     ?P("create received socket"),
 3233:     {ok, R}     = gen_udp:open(0, ROpts),
 3234:     ?P("extract received socket port"),
 3235:     {ok, RPort} = inet:port(R),
 3236: 
 3237:     ?P("create sender socket"),
 3238:     {ok, S} = gen_udp:open(0, SOpts),
 3239: 
 3240:     ?P("send to receiver (at port ~w)", [RPort]),
 3241:     ok = gen_udp:send(S, Addr, RPort, <<"aaaaa">>),
 3242: 
 3243:     ?P("attempt to receive data on specified format binary)"),
 3244:     {ok, {_,_,<<"aaaaa">>}} = gen_udp:recv(R, 0, 200),
 3245: 
 3246:     ?P("done"),
 3247:     ok.
 3248: 
 3249: 
 3250: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3251: 
 3252: %% On some linux platforms, mostly in "docker"-like environments,
 3253: %% send *can* block. This, I think, mostly depends the value of
 3254: %% system config *net.unix.max_dgram_qlen*. On Docker this can
 3255: %% be small (10). With "normal" machines this is much larger (> 500),
 3256: %% which makes this hard tp reproduce.
 3257: otp_19332(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3258:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 3259:     Cond = fun() ->
 3260:                    is_linux(),
 3261:                    is_docker(Config),
 3262:                    %% We should really test for UDS support also,
 3263:                    %% but how without using 'socket'?
 3264:                    %% Maybe its enough to open the socket (with 'local').
 3265:                    has_small_enough_dgram_qlen(20),
 3266:                    ok
 3267:            end,
 3268:     Pre  = fun() ->
 3269:                    Opts = [local,
 3270:                            {active, false},
 3271:                            {debug, true}],
 3272:                    case gen_udp:open(0, Opts) of
 3273:                        {ok, Sock} ->
 3274:                            inet:setopts(Sock, [{debug, false}]),
 3275:                            #{sock => Sock};
 3276:                        {error, Reason} ->
 3277:                            skip(?F("Failed open socket: ~p", [Reason]))
 3278:                    end
 3279:            end,
 3280:     Case = fun(State) -> do_otp_19332(State) end,
 3281:     Post = fun(#{sock := Sock}) ->
 3282:                    (catch gen_udp:close(Sock))
 3283:            end,
 3284:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 3285: 
 3286: do_otp_19332(#{sock := Sock}) ->
 3287:     ?P("begin"),
 3288: 
 3289:     0 = do_otp_19332_test(Sock),
 3290: 
 3291:     ?P("done"),
 3292:     ok.
 3293: 
 3294: do_otp_19332_test(S) ->
 3295:     do_otp_19332_test(S, 100000, #{}, 0).
 3296: 
 3297: do_otp_19332_test(_S, 0, Errs, NumR) ->
 3298:     ?P("send attempts done: "
 3299:        "~n   Errors:                   ~p"
 3300:        "~n   Number of (inet) replies: ~p", [Errs, NumR]),
 3301:     NumR;
 3302: do_otp_19332_test(S, N, Errs, NumR) ->
 3303:     Packet = lists:duplicate(100, "hello\n"),
 3304:     Errs2  =
 3305:         case gen_udp:send(S, {local, "/tmp/test.sock"}, Packet) of
 3306:             ok ->
 3307:                 ?P("UNEXPECTED SUCCESS (at ~w)", [N]),
 3308:                 exit(unexpected_success);
 3309:             {error, Reason} ->
 3310:                 case Errs of
 3311:                     #{Reason := EN} ->
 3312:                         Errs#{Reason => EN + 1};
 3313:                     _ ->
 3314:                         Errs#{Reason => 1}
 3315:                 end
 3316:         end,
 3317:     receive
 3318:         {inet_reply, S, _Ref} ->
 3319:             ?P("Got a reply"),
 3320:             do_otp_19332_test(S, N-1, Errs2, NumR+1)
 3321:     after 0 ->
 3322:             do_otp_19332_test(S, N-1, Errs2, NumR)
 3323:     end.
 3324:     
 3325: 
 3326: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3327: 
 3328: otp_19357_open_with_ipv6_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3329:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 3330:     Cond = fun() ->
 3331:                    ?P("cond check: do we support socket"),
 3332:                    case ?LIB:is_socket_supported() of
 3333:                        true ->
 3334:                            ?P("cond check: do we support ipv6"),
 3335:                            ?LIB:has_support_ipv6();
 3336:                        false ->
 3337:                            ?SKIPT("SOCKET not supported")
 3338:                    end
 3339:            end,
 3340:     Pre  = fun() ->
 3341:                    {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet6),
 3342:                    #{local_addr => Addr}
 3343:            end,
 3344:     Case = fun(State) -> do_otp_19357_open_with_ipv6_option(State) end,
 3345:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 3346:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 3347:     
 3348: do_otp_19357_open_with_ipv6_option(#{local_addr := Addr}) ->
 3349:     %% First without specifying the (bind) address:
 3350:     TryOpen = fun(No, Opts) ->
 3351:                       try gen_udp:open(0, Opts) of
 3352:                           {ok, Sock} ->
 3353:                               ?P("success ~w", [No]),
 3354:                               (catch gen_udp:close(Sock));
 3355:                           {error, Reason} ->
 3356:                               ?P("FAILED open socket ~w: "
 3357:                                  "~n   ~p", [No, Reason]),
 3358:                               exit({Reason, No})
 3359:                       catch
 3360:                           C:E ->
 3361:                               ?P("CATCHED open socket ~w: "
 3362:                                  "~n   Error Class: ~p"
 3363:                                  "~n   Error:       ~p"
 3364:                                  "~n   ~p", [No, C, E]),
 3365:                               exit({C, E, No, Opts})
 3366:                       end
 3367:               end,
 3368:     ?P("try wo address (1)"),
 3369:     TryOpen(1, [{inet_backend, socket},
 3370:                 binary,
 3371:                 inet6, {ipv6_v6only, true},
 3372:                 {reuseaddr, true}]),
 3373: 
 3374:     ?P("try w address (2)"),
 3375:     TryOpen(2, [{inet_backend, socket},
 3376:                 binary,
 3377:                 inet6, {ipv6_v6only, true},
 3378:                 {ip, Addr},
 3379:                 {reuseaddr, true}]),
 3380: 
 3381:     ?P("done"),
 3382:     ok.
 3383: 
 3384: 
 3385: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3386: 
 3387: ok({ok,V}) -> V;
 3388: ok(NotOk) ->
 3389:     try throw(not_ok)
 3390:     catch
 3391: 	throw:not_ok:Stacktrace ->
 3392: 	    raise_error({not_ok, NotOk}, tl(Stacktrace))
 3393:     end.
 3394: 
 3395: raise_error(Reason, Stacktrace) ->
 3396:     erlang:raise(error, Reason, Stacktrace).
 3397: 
 3398: local_filename(Tag) ->
 3399:     "/tmp/" ?MODULE_STRING "_" ++ os:getpid() ++ "_" ++ atom_to_list(Tag).
 3400: 
 3401: bin_filename(String) ->
 3402:     unicode:characters_to_binary(String, file:native_name_encoding()).
 3403: 
 3404: delete_local_filenames() ->
 3405:     _ =
 3406: 	[file:delete(F) ||
 3407: 	    F <-
 3408: 		filelib:wildcard(
 3409: 		  "/tmp/" ?MODULE_STRING "_" ++ os:getpid() ++ "_*")],
 3410:     ok.
 3411: 
 3412: get_localaddr() ->
 3413:     get_localaddr(["localhost", "localhost6", "ip6-localhost"]).
 3414: 
 3415: get_localaddr([]) ->
 3416:     {error, localaddr_not_found};
 3417: get_localaddr([Localhost|Ls]) ->
 3418:     case inet:getaddr(Localhost, inet6) of
 3419:        {ok, LocalAddr} ->
 3420:            ?P("found local address: ~s ~p", [Localhost, LocalAddr]),
 3421:            {ok, LocalAddr};
 3422:        _ ->
 3423:            get_localaddr(Ls)
 3424:     end.
 3425: 
 3426: 
 3427: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3428: 
 3429: is_docker(Config) ->
 3430:     case which_label(Config) of
 3431:         {ok, docker} ->
 3432:             ok;
 3433:         _ ->
 3434:             skip("Is not running in a Docker")
 3435:     end.
 3436: 
 3437: has_small_enough_dgram_qlen(Max) when is_integer(Max) ->
 3438:     case max_dgram_qlen() of
 3439:         QLen when is_integer(QLen) andalso (QLen < Max) ->
 3440:             ok;
 3441:         QLen when is_integer(QLen) ->
 3442:             skip("QLen too large: " ++
 3443:                      integer_to_list(QLen) ++ " > " ++ integer_to_list(Max));
 3444:         _ ->
 3445:             skip("Could not get qlen")
 3446:     end.
 3447: 
 3448: -define(QLEN, "net.unix.max_dgram_qlen").
 3449: max_dgram_qlen() ->
 3450:     case string:strip(sysctl(?QLEN), right, $\n) of
 3451:         "sysctl: " ++ _ ->
 3452:             %% Key does not exist...skip
 3453:             skip;
 3454:         QLenAttrStr ->
 3455:             case [string:strip(S) || S <- string:tokens(QLenAttrStr, [$=])] of
 3456:                 [?QLEN, Value] ->
 3457:                     ?P("Max DGram QLen: ~p~n", [Value]),
 3458:                     try list_to_integer(Value) of
 3459:                         QLen ->
 3460:                             QLen
 3461:                     catch
 3462:                         _:_:_ ->
 3463:                             skip
 3464:                     end;
 3465:                 _ ->
 3466:                     skip
 3467:             end
 3468:     end.
 3469:     
 3470: sysctl(Key) when is_list(Key) ->
 3471:     os:cmd(?F("~w ~s", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Key])).
 3472: 
 3473: is_net_supported() ->
 3474:     try net:info() of
 3475:         #{} ->
 3476:             ok
 3477:     catch
 3478:         error : notsup ->
 3479:             not_supported(net)
 3480:     end.
 3481: 
 3482: -define(UNIX(Flavor), {unix, Flavor}).
 3483: 
 3484: is_linux() ->
 3485:     is_platform(?UNIX(linux), "Linux").
 3486: 
 3487: is_platform(Platform, PlatformStr) ->
 3488:     case os:type() of
 3489:         Platform ->
 3490:             ok;
 3491:         _ ->
 3492:             skip("Is not " ++ PlatformStr)
 3493:     end.
 3494: 
 3495: is_not_darwin() ->
 3496:     is_not_platform(darwin, "Darwin").
 3497: 
 3498: is_not_windows() ->
 3499:     is_not_platform(win32, "Windows").
 3500: 
 3501: is_not_platform(Platform, PlatformStr)
 3502:   when is_atom(Platform) andalso is_list(PlatformStr) ->
 3503:       case os:type() of
 3504:         {unix, Platform} ->
 3505:             skip("This does not work on " ++ PlatformStr);
 3506:         {win32, nt} when (Platform =:= win32) ->
 3507:             skip("This does not work on " ++ PlatformStr);
 3508:         _ ->
 3509:             ok
 3510:     end.
 3511: 
 3512: 
 3513: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3514: 
 3515: which_label(Config) ->
 3516:     config_lookup(label, Config).
 3517: 
 3518: config_lookup(Key, Config) ->
 3519:     case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Config) of
 3520:         {value, {Key, Value}} ->
 3521:             {ok, Value};
 3522:         _ ->
 3523:             {error, not_found}
 3524:     end.
 3525: 
 3526: 
 3527: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3528: 
 3529: not_supported(What) ->
 3530:     skip({not_supported, What}).
 3531: 
 3532: skip(Reason) ->
 3533:     throw({skip, Reason}).
 3534: 
 3535: 
 3536: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3537: 
 3538: which_info(Sock) ->
 3539:     which_info([istate, active], inet:info(Sock), #{}).
 3540: 
 3541: which_info([], _Info, Acc) ->
 3542:     Acc;
 3543: which_info([Key|Keys], Info, Acc) ->
 3544:     case maps:find(Key, Info) of
 3545:         {ok, Value} ->
 3546:             which_info(Keys, Info, Acc#{Key => Value});
 3547:         error ->
 3548:             which_info(Keys, Info, Acc)
 3549:     end.
 3550: 
 3551: 
 3552: mq() ->
 3553:     pi(messages).
 3554: 
 3555: pi(Item) ->
 3556:     {Item, Val} = process_info(self(), Item),
 3557:     Val.
 3558:

 3563: %% Utils

 3565: 
 3566: open_failed_str(Reason) ->
 3567:     ?F("Open failed: ~w", [Reason]).
